column4: i just added 2 gigs of ram to my computer and now ubuntu is running comically slowly. is this a known problem or am i going to have to do some research?
research I'd say. Howmuch ram do you have total, what's your arch, and what's your workload?
yeah, that's what i was afraid of. i have 4gb total now, just running feisty x86 (not 64 bit) and this is with no workload (just on boot, and starting gnome)
that's odd. you're on 686 or later I presume?
whatever the default that it gives is
oh, yeah, duh. pentium d 950, pretty good.
is the new ram thesame spec as the existing stuff
yeah, it's exactly the same as what i already had, just 2 more sticks
what happens if you remove the old sticks?
and what happens when you remove the old sticks, and put the new sticks in their slots?
haven't tried that yet, i just booted once
ram checks will naturally take more time, so allow for that
haha ok. but i was even getting errors on various gnome startup things. (like gnome-settings daemon has failed to start, or whatever)
run memtest86, should be a boot option
